text: The following is a list of prime ministers of Equatorial Guinea, since the establishment of the office of Prime Minister of Spanish Guinea in 1963. ==List== No. Portrait Name Election Term of Office Political Party Took office Left office Time in office Republic of Equatorial Guinea Post abolished (12 October 1968 – 15 August 1982) 1 Cristino Seriche Bioko 1983 1988 15 August 1982 4 March 1992 9 years, 202 days Independent / PDGE 2 Silvestre Siale Bileka 1993 4 March 1992 1 April 1996 4 years, 28 days PDGE 3 Ángel Serafín Seriche Dougan 1999 1 April 1996 4 March 2001 4 years, 337 days PDGE 4 Cándido Muatetema Rivas — 4 March 2001 18 Julh 2004 3 years, 102 days PDGE 5 Miguel Abia Biteo Boricó 2004 18 Julh 2004 14 August 2006 2 years, 61 days PDGE 6 Ricardo Mangue Obama Nfubea — 14 August 2006 8 July 2008 1 year, 329 days PDGE 7 Ignacio Milam Tang 2008 8 July 2008 21 May 2012 3 years, 318 days PDGE 8 Vicente Ehate Tomi 2013 21 May 2012 23 June 2016 4 years, 33 days PDGE 9 Francisco Pascual Obama Asue (1949-) 2017 23 June 2016 1 February 2023 PDGE 10 Manuela Roka Botey (1973-) 2022 1 February 2023 16 August 2024 PDGE 11 Manuel Osa Nsue Nsua (1976-) — 16 August 2024 Incumbent PDGE ==Other websites== * World Statesmen – Equatorial Guinea *
title: List of prime ministers of Equatorial Guinea
